From: Cisco IOS Configuration Fundamentals Command Reference
FuncDef: To reallocate the percentage of DRAM to use for I/O memory and processor memory on CiscoÂ 3600 series routers, use the **memory-size iomem** command in global configuration mode. To revert to the default memory allocation, use the **no** form of this command.

ParaDef.Info: The percentage of DRAM allocated to I/O memory. The values permitted are **10**, **15**, **20**, **25**, **30**, **40**, and **50**. A minimum of 4 MB of memory is required for I/O memory.

Examples: The following example allocates 40 percent of the DRAM memory to I/O memory and the remaining 60 percent to processor memory:
Enter configuration commands, one per line. End with CNTL/Z.
program load complete, entry point: 0x80008000, size: 0x32ea24
ExtraInfo: When you specify the percentage of I/O memory in the command line, processor memory automatically acquires the remaining percentage of DRAM memory.
